abstract.p: Sequenom Inc and University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center will undertake large study aimed at linking genetic variations to disease (S)

block.p: Sequenom Inc. and the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center at Dallas will undertake what the company says is the largest study to date aiming to link genetic variations to disease. Sequenom and the university will study the DNA of 3,500 patients to detect which of 750,000 variations in the genetic code of those patients contribute to cardiovascular disease. The study will cost about $20 million and the university and the company will share any intellectual property resulting from the effort, said Toni Schuh, Sequenom's chief executive. The San Diego company makes machines that test for DNA variations.
